mdRecord.dcterms:description: Sullivan designed a 9-story building for retailer Schlesinger & Mayer, 1899. Became Carson, Pirie, Scott and Co., 1904. 12-story addition by D. H. Burnham and Co., 1906; 8-story addition 1961 by Holabird & Root. Both additions are south. Restoration begun 2006. Building renamed the Sullivan Center; now has several tenants, including the School of the Art Institute of Chicago and Target. -- http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carson,_Pirie,_Scott_and_Company_Building [work]
